bug.author: arraydude
bug.summary: Height is not being updated for charts
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The chart is not being re-rendered when the height or width is changed using a variable <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
height = st.slider('Chart height:', 0, 500, 400, 100)
data = np.random.randn(1000, 2) / [50, 50] + [37.76, -122.4] df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=["lat", "lon"])
st.deck_gl_chart( viewport={ 'latitude': 37.76, 'longitude': -122.4, 'zoom': 11, 'pitch': 50, 'height': height, }, layers=[{ 'type': 'HexagonLayer', 'data': df, 'radius': 200, 'elevationScale': 4, 'elevationRange': [0, 1000], 'pickable': True, 'extruded': True, }, { 'type': 'ScatterplotLayer', 'data': df, }]) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The graph should be re-rendered <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
There's no difference when we change the value <denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/how-to-make-hexagon-layer-height-value-based/1757>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/how-to-make-hexagon-layer-height-value-based/1757</denchmark-link>
